So I'm guessing the minions will only be changed for this map, but the other maps will still have the older looking ones?

We're actually not sure about that right now. For launch, this will probably be the case, as the minions were designed specifically to fit in with the architecture on the map. In the long term, we may port these to the other maps, or create new ones altogether.

I think that different minion types to fit different areas would be really nice. The minions of twisted treeline could have maybe a 'darker' feel to them, etc. But... one thing at a time :) Just an idea for an update way down the road.

I like that idea, maybe do a dominion update soon, so much fail flashes there as well. But speaking of Dominion, maybe it should be the only one that has the original minions, and Howling Abyss can have minions that look like... Poro minions =3
No. You can't hurt a poro!
That would be really hilarious :P

Repeated so devs might see:
One thing I would love to see added is the option in settings to invert orientation of the map if you are on ~~purple~~ red side. The fact of it is that on the northeast side of the map, heading southwest, your forward vision is limited. You can move the screen all you want, but there will always be an inconvenient hole in your screen at the bottom left. This is a distinct disadvantage for ~~purple~~ red side bot lane while they are defending the first turret. The side that a team is selected for should not determine a disadvantage, and this would mitigate any disadvantage based on screen layout. This pertains to Riot's design value of Clarity "Players should fight their opponents, not the game".
"But that would change the meaning of top and bot" 
People can figure out that those words relate to blue side and still go to the correct lane. Also, it would be an option you can toggle in your settings.
"I don't want my map flipped"
It would be an option.
"Your bad! Learn to play the game!" *Giant Squid of Anger* 
It is not about skill. It is about neither side having a disadvantage based on screen layout.
TL;DR We need a toggle-able option to flip the map layout for ~~purple~~ red side.
they are adjusting the camera angles so everyone see the same vision.

One question on the Epic mob encounters: Are these new interactions still going to be timed based? If so, will there be any scaling in ability frequency as the game goes on. The reason I ask is because as they stand now once you get into later game Baron and Dragon get shredded incredibly fast. Baron usually gets to use his knock only once, if that. It makes for a very unintimidating fight, especially when a lot of % max hp shred is involved. 

Possibly Baron having a set attack at specific points in his health or even an enraged mechanic under 25%? Food for thought

Right now, the scaling is similar to live. I'll bring up some potential ideas to the gameplay balance team and we'll discuss potential solutions. I like the idea of the battles scaling better, but obviously there are competitive concerns there.

Keep it going, Riot. You're doing an amazing job. As a player from December 09, I've been very happy with the updates that have come down the line. 

I was so surprised when this was announced that I thought it was a joke! Too good to be true! But, alas, Rito is proving it is one of the best gaming companies out there. Keep it up, Riot.

Most interesting news I think is the camera change.  Seems like this is a long time coming to create visual fairness for both opponents fighting from above or below.  There had long been a blue side advantage proven by win-loss statistics  and it wasn't clear if it was due to terrain symmetry differences based on drag or baron,  OR due to this vision problem for purple side trying to gaze down at the bottom of the screen with less perspective vision for how the camera is oriented.  The UI also blocks some of that vision for purple team.

I wonder how much Riot expects the blue side advantage to dwindle based on this camera change.
